TimeRanges.summary: A TimeRanges object includes one or more ranges of time, each specified by a starting time offset and an ending time offset. You reference each time range by using the start() and end() methods, passing the index number of the time range you want to retrieve.

TimeRangesLength.summary:
The TimeRanges.length read-only property returns the
number of ranges in the object.

TimeRangesEnd.summary: The end() method of the interface returns the time offset (in seconds) at which a specified time range ends.

TimeRangesStart.summary: The start() method of the interface returns the time offset (in seconds) at which a specified time range begins.
